ygData.subject: JVM crash while running a large crawl
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I am running a large crawl with Max-Toe threads being 200. The crawl does fairly well for about 40-45 min before crashing with an following error message

Hi,
      I am running a large crawl with Max-Toe threads being 200.
The cr=
awl does fairly well for about 40-45 min before crashing
with an following =
error message in the logs

INFO: GET http://home.iprimus.com.au/welling/mai=
n.html 200 4834
text/html

aught when processing
request: /home/agoel/dist/run/3/scratch/tt44http.ris =
(Too many open
files)

on) caught when processing request: 
RIS already open for ToeThread #44: ht=
tp://ja.wikipedia.org/robots.txt

o.IOException) caught when processing request: 
RIS already open for ToeThr=
ead #44: http://ja.wikipedia.org/robots.txt

ion (java.io.IOException) caught when processing request:

Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.5.0_13-b05 mixed mode) #

I think the problem is wit=
h unclosed/too many HttpRecorder I/O streams.
If this is the real issue the=
n is it a known one ?
If not then any suggestions on why this would be happ=
en?

Thanks
-Ankur
